Following the debacle with Robodebt , I am concerned if law enforcement relies on AI. However there are advantages to AI in law enforcement as AI can analyse data across systems which can assist with law enforcement. Thus I support use of AI for intelligence gathering. However I believe that government should complement with review by humans.
I think it will create efficiencies. Allow police to concentrate on actual policing rather than paperwork.
I think if it can help the public be safer overall then that's a great outcome.

I see both pros and cons - pros you can find people, things etc. However, I see a the potential of linking data sets, whereby seemingly innocuous laws change giving greater power to law enforcement. While we are in a stable democracy, that is ok. If that were to change I would not be supportive.

Terrible idea, only need to look at how project nimbus and palantir operates in Palestine and other countries to see that this is a bad idea. Surveillance without moderation or oversight will result in abuse of power.

I don't believe that there is sufficient transparency in how Australian police and security are allowed to use AI in their operations. Even if it was sufficiently transparent (according both to law and public interest), I'm not confident that this information would be user-friendly. The use of AI as a predictive technology for law enforcement purposes is still significantly under-defined, which leaves open many opportunities for abuse and misuse. Obviously this is bad for citizens (and also law enforcement & security agents themselves, who are often forgotten in this debate) but it also means that any genuinely good outcomes that might come of its use (e.g. intercepting organised crime) can be negated or reversed later in court, when laws and regulations mature.
I’m not too familiar with the ways that law enforcement uses AI. AI can be inaccurate at times so I would not be too keen on law enforcement using it.

I think Australia lags behind comperable countries when it combes to AI technology, infrastructure and leadership to be as effective as other countries in using it in law enforcement. Especially compared to other advanced economies in North America, Asia, and Europe.
